intro: Marrubium × negretense, commonly known as the hybrid horehound, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and purple or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Its hybrid origin results from crosses between Marrubium species, contributing to its unique botanical features.
